name: Club Med Cancun Yucatan

reviews.title: Best Family Vacation at any price!
reviews.text: This is the most relaxing family vacation at any price. We had three generations and all had a blast and can't wait to go back. The service is exemplary, the gourmet food outstanding and the setting second to none. It was our second trip to this resort and we anticipate many more!

reviews.title: I want to go back !!!!
reviews.text: Less than one day after coming back from CM Cancun to 4 feet of snow , I am ready to go right back.

reviews.title: the vacation of a life time
reviews.text: Now with 3 children in tow, I was a little bit apprehensive to go back to CM Cancun where I spend wild vacations in a younger life.

reviews.title: Good for families, not for singles
reviews.text: Then and now

reviews.title: Fantastic Vacation
reviews.text: CM Cancun had the best location in Cancun : one side looking at the hotel zone and two wilder sides looking toward the reef

We just returned from a fabulous vacation at Club Med Yucatan. We travelled with 2 kids aged 6 and 8, and picked this place because of the kids club. Well we hardly saw them all week. They just loved it and can't wait to go back again. The GO's are all wonderful with the children keeping them busy with creative things. The kids clubs put on 2 shows for the adults, which were performed in the evening on stage. Kids club runs from Sunday to Friday from 9am to 5:30 pm and again from 7pm to 9pm, onn the Friday kids receive a gold medal and certificate for being in the kids club. Amazing place, can't wait to go back. If you want to spend quality quiet time with your wife/husband and not have to worry about your kids this is the place to go...
reviews.title: Best Kids Club

reviews.text: Just a few notes....not an overall review.
reviews.title: Family Resort....not for Adults

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Were there in Nov and surprised at the number of kids; have been to "old" Cancun Club Med several times in the past as an adults only club; it is now distinctly a family club...lots of kids running around even in this off season. Probably will not go back.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Suprised by Club Med ...
Nice trip but not stroller friendly
reviews.text: They did a fine job renovating the club and beach is definitely better than last time.
Pool was a little chilly in early Nov...probably 75 degrees; weather was very windy our week.
reviews.title: A week in paradise!

reviews.text: We spent the week of January 5-12 at Club Med Yucatan and absolutely loved it! We are parents in our late 30's and have 2 boys (6.5 and 3.5). We travelled with 2 other families - one family had 2 girls, 5.5 and 3.5; the other family had a 3 year old boy.
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday!

reviews.text: Our family had 2 adjoining rooms and truly appreciated having our own space. The beds were comfortable and there was a lot of closet space. We had rooms on the 3rd floor overlooking the lagoon.
reviews.title: A Great Vacation!

likes.liked: — the location, the food and the staff

reviews.text: Our 6.5 year old went to the Mini Club every morning for a few hours and he loved it. The GOs were very welcoming and outgoing. He had the opportunity to sail and to do the circus trapeze which he absolutely loved. On more than one occasion he asked that we not pick him up until after lunch - he made friends and wanted to be with them.
reviews.title: Nowhere is ever perfect but this was as close as I have gotten. dec 9-19

reviews.text: Our 3.5 year old was too young for Mini Club so we hired a babysitter (Ileana) to watch him for a couple of hours every morning which let us go snorkelling, have a massage on the beach, and just relax with a book on the beach. Ileana was able to bring him to the Mini Club area where there is a playground and small pools for the little ones. She was also able to bring him indoors where he could play games, read books and do crafts.
reviews.title: Still in love with Club Med

likes.disliked: — nasty white wine in the dining room

reviews.text: We also had Ileana watch both boys 4 of the 7 nights we were there. She took them to the evening events for kids 2 of the nights and the other 2 nights the boys were already in bed before she arrived. Ileana was wonderful and the boys adored her!
reviews.title: 100 times better than Beaches

likes.liked: — The newly renovated resort is beautiful in every way
likes.disliked: — the walk from one place to another can be long

reviews.title: Great for Young Families, Lousy for Everyone Else
reviews.text: Being a "good son" (37 y/o), I took my mom (65 y/o) to Club Med Yucatan December 11-19th to celebrate her retirement. We knew the property was spread-out but didn't fully appreciate just how spread-out it was until we got there. I do not recommend this property for older travelers or people with bed knees (I'm well-traveled and there's alot of walking required here plus this was the first resort I found where you had to climb numerous stairs to access the main restaurant - again, you won't fully appreciate the wear 'n tear until you've done it a few times a day for a few days).

reviews.title: Fun Fun Fun
reviews.text: The main positive of the resort was the Club Med team of folks who were all very pleasant and helpful. This is also a good place for tennis players - the resort does a nice job of creating a little tennis "community". The beach is nice, clean, never had to fight for a chair, and the resort's towl-service was excellent. The resort is located at the southern end of the Hotel Zone so while the water was ok about half the time, sometimes it collected a fair amount of seaweed and other stuff especially so when it was windy. RE: other stuff - apparently during our stay a shark attacked and killed somebody up north and a disembodied leg was found by a Club Med snorkeler (btw - the snorkeling is decent at the resort, a few reefs to check out) which brought out La Policia. It was a little unnerving to lay on the beach that day around a few guys shouldering Uzi sub-machine guns but let's be honest - this isn't the U.S. and shark attacks DO occur. I was in the fitness center most days and it's adequate and they do offer some yoga classes and other stuff for those inclined that way. Lastly, they have some decent live music outdoors at night and about half their shows are good but note - everything repeats so if you stay longer than a week you will see the same stuff again.

reviews.title: Best place to stay in cancun
reviews.text: The main negative of the resort is that while it has one main nice-looking pool, it is not a heated pool and was freezing every day - far colder than the ocean. It definitely defeats the purpose of having a nice pool on the property so if you're going for the pool - go elsewhere is my advice. Another big negative are the kids. If you're an early-riser like myself they won't bother you but if you expect to sleep past ~7:30am - forget about it since the kids start running the halls like little beasties about that time (although for families - the Kids Camp during the day does appear to give parents a break). There are three restuarants and the food is wildly inconsistent day-to-day. You'll always find something to eat but nothing resembles fine-dining in terms of food quality... ambiance perhaps at the two reservations-required restaurants but only if parents don't allow their kids to run wild at dinner (it happens).

reviews.title: Excellent in every respect--the best all inclusive we've been to by far
reviews.text: The standard rooms at the resort are ok. My mother had one facing the ocean and I had one facing the swamplike, bayish waters (a large alligator lives in those waters). The beds were the best to report of the rooms - firm but not sooo firm plus they had quality linens. The rooms were cold with the AC on and too musty with it off. The standard rooms can be quite dangerous because the bed is only a few feet from a railing and steps down to the fridge, coffee-maker and balcony/patio. One night an elderly gentleman staying at the resort got out of bed and tripped down these stairs, smashed his face up (requiring plentiful stitching at the Cancun hospital - yikes!) and suffered a concussion. We met his son and daughter (both my age) and felt badly for him/them. Two of the eight days we were there the resort suffered brown-outs and one of those days a very large waterbug appeared in my bathroom, I killed it and didn't complain - again - this is Mexico. My advice - keep the AC on even though it gets cold. One minor annoyance was that the toilet was housed separately from the main bathroom - probably an old European vestige or something but I like to wash my hands immediately before touching anything else.

reviews.title: Great Facility, Great GOs. Great Food
reviews.text: I could say more but the bottomline is that Club Med Yucatan is good for families with kids travelling on a budget but lousy for older travelers and singles (25-40 y/o). I personally would never return there unless they gave me a free vacation.

description: Discover the wonders of Mexico in this environmentally friendly all-inclusive family resort nestled on a pristine stretch of world-famous Mayan Riviera beach. Travel to Club Med Cancun Yucatan with your family to enjoy a carefree all-inclusive vacation amidst the sumptuous amenities, natural beauty and a relaxing atmosphere that make this unique family resort as breathtaking as it is adventurous. Uncover a fresh perspective on the charm of the Mexican culture and experience a vacation filled with enhancements for the entire family. There's so much about this newly redesigned resort that will touch your family for years to come: refined accommodations, excursions* to Mayan archeological sites, a new Club Med Spa by Comfort Zone*, 3 restaurants including 1 fine Mexican dining venue and 1 serving worldwide specialties, and more.
